revisionDesc.change: Vote - AcceptText - See comments of Berkes and Gonis and follow Gonis' judgement.

Vote - ReturnToSender - BL corrections OK, but NOT those to lines 14â€“15: many editors nowadays prefer to resolve (Ï€Ï…ÏÎ¿á¿¦ (see e.g. O.Heid.). Keep the text as it is. || Some accents and spaces of number tags have to change: lin9 á¼‘Ï€Ï„á½° <#=137#> => á¼‘Ï€Ï„Î¬<#=137#>; 11 á¼”Î½Î½ÎµÎ± Ï„Î­Ï„Î±ÏÏ„Î¿Î½ <#=49#><#=1/4#> => á¼Î½Î½Î­Î±<#=49#> Ï„Î­Ï„Î±ÏÏ„Î¿Î½<#=1/4#> [or <#Ï„Î­Ï„Î±ÏÏ„Î¿Î½=1/4#>]
Vote - AcceptText - Accept. Not sure about lines 14-15: next voter?

(1) Corrected the BL reading of l. 6, where Î¾Ï…[Ïƒ]Ï„á¿· á¼”Ï€Î±[Î¹Ï„Î¿Î½] was the proposed correction, while the mention of Boubastos was only meant to discard Grenfell and Hunt's reading. (2) Fixed the Leiden+ markup of the numbers in l. 13. (3) I would suggest to expand the well-known symbol (transcribed by Wilcken in APF 3 p. 123) as "pyrou artabai" instead of just "pyrou", since it could bear both meanings (see e.g. P.Lond. I, index of symbols p. 251).

Submit - (1) Corrected the BL reading of l. 6, where Î¾Ï…[Ïƒ]Ï„á¿· á¼”Ï€Î±[Î¹Ï„Î¿Î½] was the proposed correction, while the mention of Boubastos was only meant to discard Grenfell and Hunt's reading. (2) Fixed the Leiden+ markup of the numbers in l. 13. (3) I would suggest to expand the well-known symbol (transcribed by Wilcken in APF 3 p. 123) as "pyrou artabai" instead of just "pyrou", since it could bear both meanings (see e.g. P.Lond. I, index of symbols p. 251).
changed schema; added xml:space=preserve; indented; moved title/@n to idno
Added language la-Grek; tagged num rend=fraction
Converted from TEI P4 (EpiDoc DTD v. 6) to P5 (EpiDoc RNG schema)
